definitions: To make something twice as large or as many.
To become twice as large or as many.
To fold something over on itself.
To act as a substitute for someone in a play or film, especially for dangerous scenes.
To turn sharply back on itself.
examples: They plan to double their profits this year.
The population doubled in twenty years.
She doubled the sheet of paper.
He will double for the main actor in the stunt.
The fox doubled back on its tracks.
